questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an anthropometric measurement?
questions.rationale: Anthropometry involves the measurement of the human body. MUAC, height, weight, and head circumference are all examples of anthropometric measurements used to assess nutritional status.

questions.question: The 'A' in the ABCD method of nutritional assessment stands for:
questions.rationale: The ABCD method is a mnemonic for the four primary components of nutritional assessment: Anthropometric, Biochemical, Clinical, and Dietary.
